See also: student, stüdent, and študent

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German studente, from Medieval Latin studēns.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ʃtuˈdɛnt/
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Student m (genitive Studenten, plural Studenten, female Studentin)

  1. student (male or of unspecified sex) (person attending lectures at a university)
    Synonyms: Hochschüler, Studi (informal), Studierender, Studiker (dated), Studiosus (dated)

Declension[edit]

Declension of Student
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderStudentdieStudenten
genitiveeinesdesStudentenderStudenten
dativeeinemdemStudentendenStudenten
accusativeeinendenStudentendieStudenten

Usage notes[edit]

Increasingly replaced with Studierender, see usage notes for that entry.
